channel.title: Paper on What does "working" mean here?
channel.description: Recent content in Paper on What does "working" mean here?

item.title: Text Does Not Exist
item.description: The real title of this essay is ðŸš¬ðŸ¤¡ðŸ˜³ðŸ¤¯, but hugo (the tool used to generate this blog) can’t handle emoji in the title, so we have a fake title. It’s common to imagine written works as “text,” a kind of mythical thing whose meaning is disconnected from form. In this imagining every rendering of a written work can be reduced to any other. That the arrangement of the characters, its rendering and the medium of its presentation are all subservient to the content of the text.

item.title: Text Pitch
item.description: The real title of this essay is ðŸš¬ðŸ¤¡ðŸ˜³ðŸ¤¯, but Hugo (the tool used to generate this blog) can’t handle emoji in the title, so we have a fake title. Fig 1 How does this (fake) text exchange (Fig 1) read to you? How do you read the response? To me, the response (“Mom”) is assertive and definitive. A declaration in periods. Two full stops in a short message.
